tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Participation matters (1)
stu_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK  GET READY TO READ  PARTICIPATION MATTERS
comments: Good luck is all I have to say. Even though this is a 100 level class she gives a workload for a graduate class. DO NOT TAKE unless you\'re really into AMST.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: I am a part-time student at Umass Boston, usually when I take classes, I usually manage my work load very well, but because of this class I AM DYING. Her work load is no joke at all... You have to read ALL (5-6 readings) in first of every week. I wish she can break up the readings into separate days in consideration for students who has job(s).

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Attendance is mandatory, online quiz every week and every single reading is required to be brought to class. If you do not have an electronic device to read the documents in class, you will spend lots of $$ on paper.I recommend this class for students who are truly interested in American studies. Not an easy class. Professor is nice

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Workload is ridiculous and would be "ok" if you could use your own opinion. Unfortunately it does not feel "welcomed," rather it seems it need to be hers or you lose points regardless of your effort. Not satisfied. Other AMST courses where great at UMass.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Professor Negron would not be categorized as an easy professor.She is demanding during classes and will call on everyone for input, as well as making sure each student actually read their assignment. Overall, the subject was thought provoking, and you walk away feeling like you learned something valuable

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Interesting subject. It is lots of reading and writing. She is very strict with attendance and participation as well.She does listen to all opinions and keeps a respectful tone. The class is though but it comes in handy later when you are working on other research papers. She also teaches effective reading and note taking. Worth the hard work.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: LOTS OF WORK. BUT she is an awesome professor you can gain alot of knowledge in this class very interactive and worth taken best class i have taken so far. She gives alot of work but is very understanding all you have to do is talk to her make sure you form a good relationship. once again she is AWESOME anyone who says other wise is full of B.S

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: WAY too much work that doesn\'t pay off in the end. participation in class and attendance is critical as well as completing all LENGTHY assignments thoroughly. Although the course content is amazing, the course is simply too much work. Negron cant even keep up with the amount she assigns.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: A LOT of reading. be prepared to be able to explain the entire reading to the class because you will be thoroughly questioned on it. Gives 4 major assignments that are not easy to say the least. Shes extremely wordy and likes to talk really fast. This being said the class is extremely interesting and important to history.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: She\'s new, she micromanages the course, and has no business teaching 300 level classes. Do not give your own opinion in her class, it isn\'t welcomed if it\'s not a regurgitated version of her opinion on the issues. If you\'re looking to take a course that will be enlightening, go see another professor.
